abstract: Google unveiled efforts to expand its search technology, including integration with Twitter and photo analysis.
snippet: Google unveiled efforts to expand its search technology, including integration with Twitter and photo analysis.
lead_paragraph: Google addressed the press at an event near its headquarters on Monday, talking about its advances in mobile, real-time and social search. It’s unveiling several features that could influence how people search the Web. One big change, live results from Twitter and other sites mixed in with the standard Web search results, is being introduced over the next few days.

headline.main: Google Adds Live Results From Twitter to Searches

abstract: The Federal Trade Commission’s conference on privacy and technology brought in researchers, executives from Google, Microsoft and Wal-Mart, and consumer advocates to hash out what needs to change in the privacy world.
snippet: The Federal Trade Commission’s conference on privacy and technology brought in researchers, executives from Google, Microsoft and Wal-Mart, and consumer advocates to hash out what needs to change in the privacy world.
lead_paragraph: The wonky world of online privacy has become a hot topic.

headline.main: At F.T.C. Conference, Concerns About Advertising and Privacy

abstract: The Federal Trade Commission hosts a conference on online privacy, and the conversation gets testy.
snippet: The Federal Trade Commission hosts a conference on online privacy, and the conversation gets testy.
lead_paragraph: Over on the Media Decoder blog, our colleague Stephanie Clifford reports from Monday’s Federal Trade Commission conference on online privacy.

headline.main: F.T.C. Wades Into the Swamp of Online Privacy

abstract: Google will supplement its search results with updates posted each second to sites like Twitter and Facebook.
snippet: Google will supplement its search results with updates posted each second to sites like Twitter and Facebook.
lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  Unveiling significant changes to its dominant search engine on Monday, Google said it would begin supplementing its search results with the updates posted each second to sites like Twitter, Facebook and MySpace.

headline.main: Google Adds Live Updates to Results
headline.print_headline: Google Adds Live Updates To Its Results

abstract: Google is tagging thousands of real-world businesses with QR Codes, similar to product bar codes, to make it easier for mobile-phone users to look up additional information about those places.
snippet: Google is tagging thousands of real-world businesses with QR Codes, similar to product bar codes, to make it easier for mobile-phone users to look up additional information about those places.
lead_paragraph: If you walk past the gift shop of the Museum of Modern Art in New York, or Meltdown Comics in Los Angeles, or Cheeseburger Baby in Miami, the chances are that you will see a sticker in the window that has a Google Maps logo and a one-inch-square with a series of pixelated black-and-white cubes called a QR Code.

headline.main: Putting a Bar Code on Places, Not Just Products
